title: Mandates the installation of warning labels on ultraviolet radiation devices
summary: Mandates the installation of warning labels on ultraviolet radiation devices; provides that such warning shall include the risk of irreversible damage to the user's eyes and skin, including skin cancer.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. MOLINARO, WEISENBERG, N. RIVERA, MONTESANO --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M.   of  A.  FINCH,  TITONE  --  read  once  and
         referred to the Committee on Health

       AN  ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to warning labels on
         ultraviolet radiation devices

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Paragraph  (d)  of  subdivision  2 of section 3554 of the
    2  public health law, as added by chapter 378  of  the  laws  of  1990,  is
    3  amended and a new paragraph (e) is added to read as follows:
    4    (d)  requiring each tanning facility to provide safety goggles and any
    5  other safety-related devices  to  customers  without  additional  charge
    6  therefor[.]; AND
    7    (E)  REQUIRING  EACH  TANNING  FACILITY  TO CONSPICUOUSLY POST ON EACH
    8  ULTRAVIOLET RADIATION DEVICE LABELS THAT SUFFICIENTLY  INFORM  CONSUMERS
    9  REGARDING  THE  RISKS THAT THE USE OF SUCH DEVICES POSE FOR THE DEVELOP-
   10  MENT OF IRREVERSIBLE DAMAGE TO THE EYES AND SKIN, INCLUDING SKIN CANCER.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD08268-01-1
